page.title: 02LINKENHOLT CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Linkenholt Cricket Club was started in the 1920's, re-formed in 1946 after the Second World War and still going strong. There are about 18 players, some from villages round-about. They are placed in Hampshire County Division 3. The Club has about 50 Vice-Presidents, a chairman, Treasurer and Secrearies, all being local supporters. Eighteen League matches were played on Saturdays and 18 friendly matches played on Sundays. Teas are arranged and served by players' wives. Youngsters are also encouraged to play in matches and take coaching. The field and pavilion are loaned from the Linkenholt Estate.
